messages.content: Power Noise Suite is a collection of nodes for ComfyUI that focus on latent noise input, diffusion, and latent adjustments. It is the successor to PPF_Noise_ComfyUI.
What is new in PowerNoiseSuite compared to PPF_Noise_ComfyUI?
PowerNoiseSuite has overhauled Power-Law Noise for more accurate noise representation and introduced a Tonal Guide Image in the Power KSampler to help tone generations similar to an input image.
What is the purpose of the Tonal Guide Image in Power KSampler?

The Tonal Guide Image in Power KSampler can be used to help tone a generation similar to an input image. While not always reliable, it can theme the generation very much like the input image in some instances.
How should the PowerNoiseSuite repository be installed?
The PowerNoiseSuite repository should be cloned to the 'ComfyUI/custom_nodes' directory.
What types of noise can be generated using the Power Law Noise node?
The Power Law Noise node can generate various types of power-law noise, including white, grey, pink, green, blue, and mix.
What is the purpose of the Latent Adjustment node?
The Latent Adjustment node allows adjusting latents, such as brightness, contrast, and sharpness.
What is the purpose of the Power KSampler Advanced node?

The Power KSampler Advanced node provides advanced capabilities for noise sampling in ComfyUI. It works with samplers that inject noise on every step and utilize the comfy.k_diffusion.sampling.default_noise_sampler() method.
